column3: Okay makes sense

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Excellent! We're now ready to begin the interview about urban zoning policies. Take your time with each response and provide as much detail as you'd like. Let's start with our first question.
column3: Ok

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: To what extent do you support or oppose upzoning policies that allow for higher density housing in traditionally single-family neighborhoods? Please explain your reasoning.
column3: Well, I don't really like it since I own my home and I worry that overcrowding will hurt my neighborhood, like adding to the crime rate

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What do you think are the most significant impacts, positive or negative, of increasing housing density in residential neighborhoods?
column3: Higher crime rates, people just being crowded and unhappy, no parking, increased traffic, not good views

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How do you think upzoning policies might affect housing affordability in urban areas?
column3: It could make housing more affordable for renters for sure

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What impact do you believe increased housing density might have on neighborhood character and quality of life?
column3: It will decline, more crime, more traffic, no parking

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How do you think upzoning might affect transportation systems and traffic congestion in cities?
column3: There will be much more traffic, harder to get to a freeway, more smog, more carbon monoxides, more stress

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What role do you believe local government should play in regulating housing development and density?
column3: They should be actively involved and not favor corporate interests

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How might environmental concerns factor into decisions about urban density and zoning?
column3: Too much smog, carbon monoxide, reduced air quality

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What economic effects, both positive and negative, might result from changing zoning laws to allow more multi-family housing?
column3: It will help local small businesses and it could lower rents, but I don't trust that

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How do you think the interests of current residents versus future residents should be balanced when making zoning decisions?
column3: I think current residents take precedence

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What role do you think social equity and access to opportunity play in discussions about zoning and housing policy?
column3: Its really hard, since I do care, but I care about my life more

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How would you describe the relationship between Higher density housing and Support for Upzoning? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It is a strong connection, but it represents corporate interests mosstly, so I am opposed

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What causes changes in Support for Upzoning? Are these influences strong or weak?
column3: Corporations want to build higher more density buildings so they can make more money

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Does Crowding and unhappiness have a positive or negative effect on Support for Upzoning, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Yes, it has a negative effect, it is very strong, we want to preserve our peace and raise our famillies in peace here

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Is the effect of Housing affordability on Support for Upzoning immediate, or does it take time to develop? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It takes time to develop I think and I won't wait around that long to be honest

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How confident are you that changes in Increased housing density leads to decline in neighborhood character lead to changes in Support for Upzoning? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Very confident, and that is why I oppose it

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How confident are you that changes in Increased housing density leads to more traffic lead to changes in Support for Upzoning? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Very confident and it has been seen in other communities in Los Angeles especially

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How would you describe the relationship between Difficulty accessing freeways and Support for Upzoning? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Strong connection, accessing freeways leads to not wanting upzoning at all, its already so bad where I live now

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How confident are you that changes in Anti-corporate bias lead to changes in Support for Upzoning? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Anti-corporate sentiment directly results in negative feelings about upzoning

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How confident are you that changes in Air Quality lead to changes in Support for Upzoning? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: that is one of the most important things to preserve and to oppose upzoning

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Would small changes in Potential decrease in rents lead to noticeable changes in Support for Upzoning, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Some renters may have support for upzoning due to this, but not home owners

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: How would you describe the relationship between Distrust towards outcomes of zoning law changes and Support for Upzoning? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: The distrust means that people will oppose upzoning every step of the way

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Would small changes in Zoning decisions lead to noticeable changes in Support for Upzoning, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Well the corporations will make small changes so as to disarm opponents and be sneaky

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: What factors affect Upzoning policies, and which ones have the strongest influence? Please also indicate if these influences are positive (increasing) or negative (decreasing).
column3: Rent being lowered is the only positive that I see.  Traffic, pollution, no parking, crowding, crime are the main negative

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Does Building higher density buildings have a positive or negative effect on Support for Upzoning, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: it makes it negative that is why people are opposing it

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Is the effect of Negative Effect on Support for Upzoning on Support for Upzoning immediate, or does it take time to develop? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Right now there is a negative vibe among homeowners and a positive vibe towards it for renters

session_1747369614395_whxss0e: Does Decline in neighborhood character have a positive or negative effect on Support for Upzoning, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It has a negative effect on support for upzoning, since it will definitely change the composition and character of a neighbborhood
